Award.AwardTitle: PFI-TT: Using Big Data Analytics to Empower K-12 Teachers for Instructional Improvement
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Partnerships for Innovation - Technology Translation (PFI-TT) project is to develop an online platform for collaborative learning and analytics for global education. The proposed technology uses the latest developments in educational big data and machine learning techniques to empower K-12 teachers for instructional improvement. K-12 school systems have become the latest frontier in big data, as the COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the digital transformation of teacher and student learning with artificial intelligence playing a key role. Despite a great societal need, K-12 systems remain one of the areas least transformed by technology. Teachers currently lack the kind of technological tools that can efficiently support their lesson plan, reflection, and learning. The proposed technology aims to address these needs and may have potential to generate economic value, as education technology places a critical role in advancing the human capital needed to drive economic growth. This team, led by women and people of color, will broaden participation by piloting the initial prototype in schools that serve large proportions of students of color from low-income families.

The proposed project uses a participatory design-based implementation approach to co-design with and for teachers. The proposed technology will include libraries of high-quality instructional materials that teachers can adapt and incorporate into their own lesson plans. The platform leverages machine learning analytics to allow teachers to efficiently conduct self-learning and be mentored and coached by other teachers. Moreover, the development of this technology will incorporate a rigorous, quasi-experimental approach that combines both quantitative and qualitative evidence to examine its effectiveness on improving teaching and student outcomes, as well as factors that moderate its usefulness in schools. The proposed technology will be supported by a team that represents the ecosystems necessary for its ongoing success, including expertise in education and data science research, product development and technology transfer, and marketing and business strategy.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
In 2021, the Colleague (a.k.a., Collaborative Learning and Analytics for Global Education) project received a $249,996 award entitled “PFI-TT: Using Big Data Analytics to Empower K-12 Teachers for Instructional Improvement.” This project aimed to develop Colleague AI, an innovative platform that supports K-12 teachers in creating, modifying, and searching for high-quality lesson plans. This platform curates high-quality lesson plans in text, image, and video formats under Creative Commons Licenses. The repository includes thousands of Open Educational Resources, which are assessed by experts in K-12 education, providing teachers with easily accessible, high-quality educational content. A significant feature of Colleague is its integration with AI, including Large Language Models (LLMs), to enhance lesson planning while ensuring rigor and inclusivity through human-supervised content curation. Additionally, the lesson planning process is guided by templates co-developed with classroom teachers and STEM education researchers. The project sought to answer research questions related to what makes lesson plans effective, how AI and human expertise can assess instructional quality, and how the platform can improve teacher efficiency and student outcomes.

Key Outcomes and Findings:
Over three years, the Colleague AI platform has evolved significantly, incorporating advances in AI to streamline lesson planning for teachers. Key project achievements include:

  • Development of a High-Quality Content Framework for Math Education: The research team identified key metrics to construct a comprehensive framework for high-quality, inclusive lesson materials. These metrics include rigor in aligning content with learning standards (such as the Common Core State Standards), engaging instructional activities, and differentiated, inclusive strategies for diverse student populations, including students with disabilities or different language backgrounds.

  • AI-Powered Lesson Curation: The platform leverages both supervised machine learning and LLMs to assess the quality of lesson plans across various aspects, including the metrics identified by the established framework and writing quality. AI capabilities assist teachers by generating lessons, improving existing lesson plans, and providing suggestions, all of which are scrutinized by human expert reviews to ensure accuracy and quality control. This participatory approach, involving human expert evaluations, ensures that AI-powered curation is accurate and aligned with educational goals.

  • User Experience and User-Centered Design: Through co-design sessions with K-12 teachers and UX/UI experts, identifying key pain points and preferences. The project developed and tested multiple versions of Colleague platform prototypes, leading to a high-fidelity version with an intuitive interface. The final platform includes intuitive features that allow teachers to search for lessons, generate new plans using AI-powered chat functions, which were well received by teachers during user testing. Teachers noted that Colleague saved them time and improved the quality of their lesson planning, allowing for more creativity and focus on student engagement.

  • Business Model and Ecosystem Development: The project successfully generated a business model and gained a thorough understanding of the educational ecosystem to support school adaptation, which positioned the team for success in pursuing SBIR Phase I funding and led to the spin-off of Colleague AI as a small business. Participation in the NSF I-Corps Teams program, which involved over 100 stakeholder interviews, provided valuable insights into the market for secondary math and science teachers, refining the product's focus and guiding the business strategy. The team adopted a freemium business model, offering different tiers for individuals and institutions, and developed a clear value proposition, sales channels, and revenue structure. These efforts set the foundation for further technology development through SBIR Phase I funding and future commercialization.

Broader Impacts and Societal Benefits:
Colleague AI has the potential to transform classroom teaching by enhancing teacher efficiency and instructional quality. Its AI-powered features offer substantial time savings, allowing educators to focus more on student engagement and individualized instruction. The platform’s inclusive design supports teachers working with students from diverse backgrounds, including those with special educational needs. In addition to supporting teachers, Colleague provides a resource for parents and new educators who may lack formal training in lesson planning, helping to improve learning outcomes beyond the classroom. 

Additionally, the project contributed to the development of design principles for AI use in K-12 educational settings, focusing on the ways AI can support teachers and improve instructional effectiveness. These principles are crucial for the creation of educational technologies that enhance teaching productivity and student outcomes. The project has also contributed to the professional development of early-career researchers and students, who gained valuable experience in machine learning, education technology, and user-centered design.

In terms of societal impact, Colleague AI democratizes access to high-quality, inclusive instructional materials. The platform provides a valuable resource for teachers in under-resourced schools, helping them access the latest teaching materials and methods. Additionally, the collaboration with state and district-level educational agencies ensures that the platform’s contributions reach a broader audience and influence statewide educational policies.

Summary: Colleague is poised to make a lasting impact by helping teachers deliver more personalized, high-quality education, ultimately enhancing student learning outcomes across diverse educational settings.
